summary: Diff adds a full authenticated frontend flow (Internet Identity login screen, app layout with logout, transactions UI with month picker, summary totals + chart, and an in-app monthly reminder banner) and a Motoko backend with transaction APIs. However, several backend data-model and persistence acceptance criteria are not evidenced (stable persistence, transaction id/createdAt), and monthly ordering is not clearly implemented. The diff also introduces unrequested access-control/admin-token and user profile features.

missing_requirements.requirement: Persist per-user transactions in stable storage so data survives canister upgrades.
missing_requirements.reason: The backend uses in-memory `Map.empty` for `userTransactionsMap` and `userProfiles`, but the diff excerpt does not show any `stable var`, `preupgrade/postupgrade`, or other stable-structure persistence implementation.

missing_requirements.requirement: Each transaction includes: unique id, kind (income/expense), amount, date, note, createdAt timestamp.
missing_requirements.reason: The `Transaction` type shown contains `transactionType`, `amount`, `date`, and `note` only; no unique `id` and no `createdAt` are evidenced. Also `kind` is represented as `transactionType` but the acceptance criteria explicitly calls out `kind` plus required metadata fields.

missing_requirements.requirement: Transactions within a selected month are ordered by date (newest first).
missing_requirements.reason: `getTransactionsForMonth` filters and then returns `toArray().reverse()`. There is a `compareByDate` helper, but no sort is evidenced; reversing insertion order does not guarantee newest-by-date ordering.

hallucinated_features.description: Custom authorization/access-control system with admin permissions and secret-token initialization.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest specifies Internet Identity auth and gating, but does not request an additional admin/permission layer or secret URL parameter initialization; the diff includes AccessControl/MixinAuthorization and `_initializeAccessControlWithSecret` driven by a `caffeineAdminToken` URL parameter.

hallucinated_features.description: User profile creation/management (name) and forced profile setup dialog after login.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest does not mention user profiles; diff adds `UserProfile` backend methods and a frontend `ProfileSetupDialog` flow that blocks the app until a name is saved.
